channel.title: Standalone software on open-archaeo
channel.description: Recent content in Standalone software on open-archaeo

item.title: AIS
item.description: Archaeological Information System

item.title: Alligator
item.description: A Web tool for converting CAs with dating information to relative time intervals as RDF.

item.title: anatolia-bibliography-map
item.description: The goal of this project is to spatially locate bibliographic resources regarding the archaeology of Anatolia (modern Turkey). This takes the bibliography of archaeology to the next level by showing not only the topics and authors, but where the archaeological research is being done.

item.title: anfo
item.description: The ANFO ancient DNA mapper.

item.title: angsd
item.description: Program for analysing next generation sequencing data.

item.title: AntCaller
item.description: SNP calling and genotyping for damaged DNA.

item.title: ArboDat
item.description: A program package for registering and importing data of archaeobotanical analyses including contexts of samples as well as evaluation tools.

item.title: archaeological-object-sharing
item.description: An online space for sharing data, 3d models, etc about archaeological objects to enable the comparison of these objects.

item.title: ArchAIDE
item.description: Tool for the automatic recognition of archaeological pottery.

item.title: arches
item.description: Arches is a web platform for creating, managing, & visualizing geospatial data. Arches was inspired by the needs of the Cultural Heritage community, particularly the widespread need of organizations to build & manage cultural heritage inventories.

item.title: arches-via-docker
item.description: Deployment of Arches via Docker for archaeology and related instruction.

item.title: archiedb
item.description: A light-weight database application designed to standardize and simplify data entry of archaeological or historical artifacts

item.title: ARFloorPlanApp
item.description: Floor plan app using augmented reality.

item.title: ARIADNA
item.description: Machine Learning Method for Ancient DNA Variant Discovery.

item.title: ark-addons
item.description: This is a Django project to obtain statistical information from an ARK project. It is aimed to mine data from archaeological databases and create customizable visualizations, querying both text and geographical data.

item.title: ARK1
item.description: The ARK v1.1.2 Stable Release. ARK (The Archaeological Recording Kit) is a web-based ’toolkit’ for the collection, storage and dissemination of archaeological data. It includes data-editing, data-creation, data-viewing and data-sharing tools, all of which are delivered using a web-based front-end.

item.title: Ark2
item.description: ARK (The Archaeological Recording Kit) 2.0 Development Repository. ARK (The Archaeological Recording Kit) is a web-based ’toolkit’ for the collection, storage and dissemination of archaeological data. It includes data-editing, data-creation, data-viewing and data-sharing tools, all of which are delivered using a web-based front-end.

item.title: ArkScan
item.description: A simple gui app to simplify scanning single context plans.

item.title: atlas
item.description: A set of tools that cover all programs necessary to obtain variant calls, estimates of heterozygosity and more from a BAM file.

item.title: babylonian-hours
item.description: A digital clock which computes your local time in ‘seasonal-hours’.

item.title: BAM
item.description: A tool for the geospatial analysis, literary network visualization, and plot mapping of ancient texts.

item.title: Bonify
item.description: Access and visualize 3D models of faunal remains.

item.title: BraDypUS
item.description: Creating, impementing and publishing relational databases on the Web, especially for the archaeolgical domain.

item.title: caddonet
item.description: Peer reviewed and indexed articles published on Caddo archaeology since 2000.

item.title: calibrator
item.description: Small command line tool for 14C calibration.

item.title: CharTool
item.description: CharTool is a macro tool for quantifying charcoal particles for paleoecological research applications.

item.title: cherish
item.description: Cherish is a tool that aids archaeologists and designers to represent historical, urban and archaeological structures and sites in 3D by means of image manipulation and sketching. Combine disparate data types such as photographs, illustrations, diagrams, text annotations, point cloud representation, etc, into a comprehensive 3D space, to make 3D sense of the data.

item.title: cherish-installer
item.description: Installer files for Cherish software.

item.title: ChronoLog
item.description: A tool for computer-assisted chronological research.

item.title: chronomodel
item.description: Chronological Modelling of Archaeological Data using Bayesian Statistics.

item.title: civ5-prehistoric
item.description: Extends the game back millions years and multiple eras into the days when “man” first descended from the trees!

item.title: Consensify
item.description: Consensify method for error reduction in ancient DNA pseudohaploidisation.

item.title: ContamLD
item.description: Software designed to estimate autosomal contamination in ancient DNA samples.

item.title: Crossbones
item.description: Crossbones autogenerates 3D schematic skeletons, making rapid surveying and visualisation of dense skeletal assemblages a snap.

item.title: DamageProfiler
item.description: A Java based tool to determine damage patterns on ancient DNA as a replacement for mapDamage.

item.title: DamMet
item.description: A full probabilistic model for mapping ancient methylomes.

item.title: DATES
item.description: Method for dating admixture in ancient DNA specimens.

item.title: dedalo
item.description: Dedalo is a knowledge management system for Cultural Heritage (tangible and intangible), Natural Heritage and Oral History/Memory.

item.title: dice
item.description: Joint estimate of demography and contamination for nuclear ancient DNA.

item.title: DRAC-calculator
item.description: DRAC is a Dose Rate and Age Calculator which has been designed to calculate environmental dose rates (_) and ages for trapped charge dating applications

item.title: E5
item.description: E5 is a generalized data entry program intended for archaeologists that works with a configuration file where the data entry fields are defined

item.title: EAGER-CLI
item.description: A fully reproducible and state-of-the-art ancient DNA analysis pipeline.

item.title: EAGER-GUI
item.description: A fully reproducible and state-of-the-art ancient DNA analysis pipeline.

item.title: epiPALEOMIX
item.description: A fast, accurate, and automatic pipeline for generating nucleosome and methylation maps from high throughput sequencing data underlying ancient samples.

item.title: Fiche Stratigraphique NumÃ©rique (FSN)
item.description: Fiche Stratigraphique Numerique (FSN) is an application project for field recording and management of archaeological operations data.

item.title: gargammel
item.description: A set of programs aimed at simulating ancient DNA fragments. For ancient hominin samples our program can also simulate various levels of present-day human contamination and microbial contamination.

item.title: GigaMesh
item.description: A modular software for display, editing and visualization of 3D-data typically acquired with structured light scanning (SLS) or structure from motion (SfM).

item.title: GlobaLID-App
item.description: The GlobaLID web app

item.title: hammurabi-markov
item.description: Simple VueJS page generating fake laws of Hammurabi.

item.title: harris-matrix
item.description: Harris Matrix Visualization for the web using D3 + KLayJS-D3.

item.title: heurist
item.description: A web-based data management infrastructure that allows researchers to design, create, manage, analyse and publish their own richly-structured database(s) through a simple web interface, without the need for programmers or consultants.

item.title: historical-geocoding-assistant
item.description: Tool for assisted geocoding of historical datasets (something between a manual table editing and automated geocoding script)

item.title: hsv-api
item.description: Historical Street View API

item.title: iDAI.field
item.description: The German Archaeological Instituteâs (DAI) new take on a field research documentation system. Combining features of GIS, photo management, and database management systems in a unique and integrating manner, it aims at facilitating archaeological workflows by reducing the overhead of using multiple systems. Developed in-house by the DAIâs information technology department, it targets primarily the needs of the instituteâs excavations, older ones as well as those to come. Yet, due to the nature of its adjustable data model and the fact it is open source software, any interested third party is free to reuse and adjust it to their needs.

item.title: Image enhancement process tool
item.description: This software implements five state of the art algorithms aimed to enhance the quality of underwater images.

item.title: IOSACal
item.description: IOSACal is an open source tool for radiocarbon calibration

item.title: ishtar
item.description: Ishtar is a database project for managing archaeological data and documentation from archaeological operations, that prioritizes maximum traceability of the information. Designed to enable inter-database communication, the Ishtar project aims rather to a distributed information model than a centralized one: communication between the databases is favored.

item.title: katun
item.description: Tools for converting between Maya and Western calendars.

item.title: leeHom
item.description: Bayesian reconstruction of ancient DNA fragments.

item.title: MADAM
item.description: Two-level de novo assembly strategy for ancient bacterial genomes.

item.title: MALT
item.description: A sequence alignment and analysis tool designedfor processing high-throughput sequencing data, especially in the context of metagenomics.

item.title: mapping-iterative-assembler
item.description: Consensus calling (or “reference assisted assembly”), chiefly of ancient mitochondria.

item.title: marbleplan
item.description: Loading a Marble Plan fragment.

item.title: MAX
item.description: An online tool for the comparative analysis of museum databases.

item.title: maximum-likelihood-relatedness-estimation
item.description: Infer biological relatedness from low coverage 2nd generation sequencing data.

item.title: maya-calendar
item.description: Tools for converting between Maya and Western calendars.

item.title: meshlab
item.description: These tools are meant to help you render orthographic views of 3D models for archaeological publication by simplifying, segmenting, cleaning and rendering 3D meshes.

item.title: MultiVCFAnalyzer
item.description: A SNP filtering and SNP alignment generation tool, designed around (but not limited to) low coverage ancient DNA data.

item.title: nervia
item.description: Management system for physical storage of archaeological finds

item.title: NgsRelate
item.description: Infer relatedness, inbreeding coefficients and many other summary statistics for pairs of individuals.

item.title: Open Context Python Code Repository
item.description: This project represents the current evolution of Open Context. It’s intended to be an easier to maintain code-base, and to make the data published by Open Context easier to maintain.

item.title: Open History Map
item.description: A web-GIS platform containing spatial historical and archaeological data.

item.title: OpenAtlas
item.description: An open source, web based database system for complex archaeological, historical and geospatial data.

item.title: paleocore
item.description: Towards a data standard for paleoanthropology.

item.title: paleomix
item.description: Pipelines and tools for the processing of ancient and modern High-Throughput Sequencing (HTS) data.

item.title: PaleoView
item.description: A visualization tool for paleoclimatic modeling data.

item.title: photogrammetry-object-scannner
item.description: Created for the very-specific purpose of communicating via android with a raspberry pi running a scanner.

item.title: pileupcaller
item.description: Sample alleles from low coverage sequence data.

item.title: PMDtools
item.description: Compute postmortem damage patterns and decontaminate ancient genomes.

item.title: poseidon-framework
item.description: Poseidon is a framework that seeks to provide standardized ways to store and share archaeogenetic, and perhaps more broadly, molecular archaeological datasets.

item.title: READ
item.description: A method to infer the degree of relationship (up to second degree, i.e. nephew/niece-uncle/aunt, grandparent-grandchild or half-siblings) for a pair of low-coverage individuals.

item.title: rekrei
item.description: Platform for crowdsourcing the digital recreation of lost heritage

item.title: RoomAccum
item.description: Room Accumulation Simulation ro estimate archaeological population growth rates.

item.title: RTIBuilder
item.description: A software interface to a set of tools that process your captured image set to produce the final RTI files. The RTIBuilder download includes the Hemispherical Harmonics (HSH) fitter to create .rti files.

item.title: RTIViewer
item.description: Enables you to view and explore Reflectance Transformation Imaging (RTI) files at very high resolution (Polynomial Texture Maps, Hemispherical Harmonics Map, and Multiview RTI). You can view image files stored on your local file system, and remote files through HTTP.

item.title: schmutzi
item.description: Maximum a posteriori estimate of contamination for ancient samples.

item.title: scikit-beam
item.description: Data analysis tools for X-Ray, Neutron and Electron sciences

item.title: shiny_DRAC
item.description: graphical interface for DRAC

item.title: shootpoints-web-api
item.description: Back-end and middleware for the ShootPoints Web total station surveying program.

item.title: shootpoints-web-frontend
item.description: User interface to the ShootPoints Web total station surveying program.

item.title: snpAD
item.description: Implements an iterative method to jointly estimate error rates and genotypes frequencies from the data.

item.title: Stratibase
item.description: Stratibase is a minimal field recording database application (currently in FileMaker FP7 format software), aimed at the simplest structure possible to perform the basic functions of a stratigraphic recording.

item.title: strativerse
item.description: A collection of time-stratigraphic publications.

item.title: survey2gis
item.description: A little tool for processing survey data, such as produced by a GPS or total station, and export it as topologically cleaned data fit for use in GIS.

item.title: Tachy2GIS
item.description: Enables you to create geometries directly from tachymeter input while at the same time adding vertices manually.

item.title: THANADOS
item.description: An open source, web application for the presentation of archaeological data especially for burial studies.

item.title: tkgwv2
item.description: An ancient DNA relatedness pipeline for ultra-low coverage whole genome shotgun data.

item.title: TOPAS
item.description: A toolkit for efficient manipulation of sequence data in various ways.

item.title: totalopenstation
item.description: Total Open Station downloads and exports survey data from your total station.

item.title: Vessel-Measuring-Tool
item.description: Digitize archeological drawings of vessels in order to calculate their capacity and weight.

item.title: xraylib
item.description: xraylib is a library containing over 40 functions to be used to retrieve data from some of the most respected databases of physical data in the field of X-ray

item.title: xylib
item.description: ylib is a portable library for reading files with x-y data from powder diffraction, spectroscopy, or other experimental methods
